    Cory Gardner

    PhD Candidate in Computer Science

    • Saint Louis University

    Research

    My research spans computational biology, high-performance computing, and machine learning privacy. Iâ€™m particularly focused on developing scalable methods for analyzing complex biological data.

    Current Projects

    Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning for Biomedical Data

    PyTorch Privacy Deep Learning

    Investigating membership and property inference attacks against machine learning models trained on biomedical data, with a focus on developing privacy-preserving techniques that maintain accuracy while protecting sensitive information.

    Active 2024 - Present

    Anomaly Detection in Medical Images

    Deep Learning Computer Vision Wavelets

    Developing novel deep learning approaches for detecting anomalies in medical images with minimal supervision, using wavelet-based feature extraction and self-supervised learning techniques.

    Active 2024 - Present

    Previous Projects

    De Novo Haplotype-Level Assembly of Hybrid Yeast

    Bioinformatics Genome Assembly Python

    Generated a chromosome-level subgenome-aware de novo assembly of the Saccharomyces bayanus yeast genome, revealing novel insights into subgenome divergence following hybridization events.

    Completed 2021 - 2024 Publication

    GPU-Accelerated CT Image Analysis

    CUDA C++ GPU Computing

    Developed optimized CUDA implementations for CT image preprocessing and quality assessment, achieving substantial performance improvements while maintaining accuracy.

    Completed 2020 - 2021

    Metagenomic Analysis & Sample Origin Prediction

    Metagenomics Machine Learning R

    Created computational methods for analyzing low-biomass microbial samples and predicting their geographical origins using machine learning techniques applied to taxonomic profiles.

    Completed 2019 - 2020 Best Presentation

    Research Impact

    Interdisciplinary Approach

    Bridging computational methods with biological insights

    Performance Optimization

    Reducing computation time from days to hours through GPU acceleration

    Privacy Protection

    Advancing secure machine learning for sensitive biomedical data
